title: Mozilla Thunderbird - Primary Password
creator: txgrgaaud
content:
Hi,

I would like to kindly ask you about a Primary Password to Mozilla Thunderbird software. I am wondering about the sense of this feature and why it works in so narrow range.

Everyone who's using Mozilla Thunderbird can easily set a Primary Password in Tools > Settings > Privacy & Security > Passowrds > check Use a Primary Password tab. There is also a short description about this feature: A Primary Password protects all your passwords, but you must enter it once per session.

I am wondering why it protect only in that way? Why this password do not protect from reading all messages for email accounts. After all, informations included in emails are the most important value I would like to protect.

As a user, I would really like to and wish to have a built-in feature which will protect all my emails in Mozilla Thunderbird, not only user settings and passwords.

regards,
metadata: ;category:customize;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;product:thunderbird

title: Default "From" address
creator: tcluster
content: When composing a new message (in other words, not replying to a message) I want them to always show the default email address, the one corresponding to the top account. The field "Outgoing Server (SMTP)" shows (Default), and ordinarily it works fine, but occasionally it will use one of the other email addresses. In reading your responses to other questions I've seen that the default address is only used when TB can't figure out which address to use. Is there some way I can tell TB to ALWAYS use the default address when composing a new message?

title: Folder Tabs & Windows Always Synchronize
creator: YogaBookMark
content:
I have a new (one month old) Lenovo Yoga Book 9i with Win 11 and Thunderbird 115.7.0 (64-bit) installed, using Maildir folders. When opening another tab or window to view another folder (Right click, "Open in New Tab" or "Open in New Window"), the new tab or window opens in the new folder as it should. But so does the original tab/window! Opening further tabs and windows and switching between tabs/ windows and clicking on a new folder in any of the open tabs or windows results in all tabs and windows always being synchronized.  In other words, I cannot view two or more separate e-mail folders. They always all synchronize back to one folder. I can never have two different Thunderbird e-mail folders open at the same time!

Never had an issue like this before on other computers or earlier versions of Win/TB, including the same version of TB set up exactly the same way in Win 10 on another computer. As this is my only Win 11 machine, I cannot test it elsewhere. Has anyone else experienced this? Is it a problem with Win 11? Is there a solution, TB config setting perhaps?
metadata: ;category:other;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/121.0.0.0 Safari/537.36 Edg/121.0.0.0;product:thunderbird

title: Force confirmation of reading the message Mozilla Thunderbird / Wymuszenie potwierdzenia przeczytania wiadomości w Mozilla Thunderbird
creator: webmaster151
content:
Hello How to force confirmation of delivery and reading of messages in Mozilla Thunderbird? The idea is that the recipient must always confirm receipt of the e-mail message and that this confirmation of receipt and reading goes to the sender of the message. If the recipient presses the button, nothing happens, i.e. receipt of the message is not confirmed. Will this functionality also work for recipients who have another email client, e.g. Microsoft Outlook or others?

Witam Jak wymusić potwierdzenie dostarczenia i przeczytania wiadomości w Mozilla Thunderbird? Chodzi o to żeby odbiorca zawsze musiał potwierdzić otrzymanie wiadomości e-mail i żeby to powierdzenie otrzymania i przeczytania trafiało do nadawcy wiadomości. Jeśli odbiorca naciks przycisk nie nic się nie dzieje tzn otrzymanie wiadomości nie jest potwierdzane. Czy ta funkcjonalność będzie działała takze dla odbiorców, którzy mają innego klienta pocztowego np Microsoft Outlook i inne?
metadata: ;category:customize;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:122.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/122.0;product:thunderbird

content:

Tem uma ou outra mensagem que o Thunderbird não recebe do meu email. 1 - Não tenho filtro configurado. 2 - O email não está indo pro spam. 3 - Protocolo: IMAP 4 - Servidor gmail 5 - Meu sistema operacional é o macOS. 6 - Meu Mac é recente ( 2 anos de lançado, m1)

Me ajudem, please. Grato, Angel Luís

title: Cannot retrieve mail after pwd change
creator: paul.cassel
content:
I had to change my gmail pwd due to a possible security breach as reported to me by Experian.

After the change, Tbird flashed this error message upon the next startup (please see image)

After about 20 minutes of poking about, I found where I could change the password for my google account. I changed it to the new password. There is zero chance I got it wrong because I copy/pasted it from my pwd mgr. I still get this error message making T'bird useless to me.

I'm definitely let down that such as simple op as pwd change was so difficult to find and now seems impossible to do. I haven't a CLUE what the STAT command is or how to address this condition.

Any suggestions are greatly welcomed.

title: Cannot send emails from Windows 10 and 11 PCs
creator: paulmason1
content:
For several weks my wife and I have been unable to use Thunderbird to send emails from our laptops (Windows 10) and my desktop (Windows 11). I attach screenshots of my settings below (sorry don't know how to blank out names!) We can receive emails. We can also send and receive emails from iOS on iPhones and iPads with no problems.

Our emails service is provided by easily.uk from which I rent the domain name. Easily have given me other settings to try but these do not work either. Perhaps it would help if I include a screenshot of the latest email and settings below. When I try these setings I cannot receive emails either!

I can use webmail satisfactorily.

We have used Thunderbird for 20 years I think without problem. As a result I make a monthly donation to Thunderbird. I would be sorry to have to give up using it.

Please can you help?

Paul Mason, UK

title: hundreds of solutions to the problem of permanently threaded messages
creator: patriciacravener
content:
There are many answers to the question of how to disable message threading. All are from earlier versions than mine, which is 115.7.0 -- as witnessed: Sorry! 0 results found for ‘disable threading in version 115.7.0’ for ‘Thunderbird'

Thunderbird seems to have so many minor changes and alterations in the recent past, that basic usability is affected. Not a good thing.

Once before, a few years ago, Thunderbird got so out of control that I had to go to a different mail client. Are we back to that?
